The humor and satire in this image stem from the contrast between expectations and reality when using portable gaming devices. 

On the left, a simple silhouette shows a passenger seemingly enjoying a portable gaming device, implying an ideal, hassle-free experience. 

On the right, a more realistic depiction shows the device displaying a message: "No Internet; the game does not work without internet," highlighting a common frustration. 

The text "YES, BUT" suggests that while the idea of portable gaming is appealing, the reality doesn't always match expectations due to dependency on internet connectivity. This plays on the irony of technological convenience not always being as convenient as it appears.
